div.bibl: Krasnow Scrapbooks, Vol. I, Owned by Dr. H. R. Krasnow, 4601 N. Broadway, Chicago, Illinois. [PROTEST MEETING]

body.p: Saturday, May 24, 1919, at the West Side Auditorium (corner Taylor and Racine), a mass protest meeting will be held, demanding the opening of the border and a withdrawal of the army of the Allies from Russia.
There will be speakers in all languages. An orchestra will play.
It begins at 7:30 P. M. Admission free.
It is the duty of every worker to be at this meeting. The meeting is under the auspices of the Conference of Russian Labor Organizations.
